title: Lengths With Chef, "Flemmish Merrymakers", ca. 1797
medium:
Medium: plain weave cotton
Technique:printed by engraved plate
inscribed:
a: On front: " MANUFACTURE. DE OBERKAMPF. A JOUY PRES VERSAILLES BON TEINT" within flattened oval cartouche and "D 100" (both in black). "LDB" within box in red. On back: "85931 1/2", "14" and "2(4)5' in pale red.
b. On front:one end of a flattened oval cartouche in black. On back: "14" and "2(4)5" in dull red.
c. On front: "D100" in black and "J.B.R." within box in red. On back: "85927 (undecipherable)" in dull red.
provenance: Formerly in the collection of Elinor merrell where it was No. 2A on her list of chefs de piece.
dimensions:
a. Warp: 185cm (73in.). Weft: 94cm. (37in.) Both selvedges present.
b. Warp: 176cm (69 1/2in.) Weft: 31.5cm (12 1/2in.) All edges cut 
c. Warp: 178.5cm (70 1/2in.). Weft: 26cm (11in.).
Pattern: Height of repeat: 99cm (39in.)
description: Scenes of people enjoying food and drink in a rural landscape. Red on white.

tombstone.epitaph:
Lengths With Chef, "Flemmish Merrymakers", ca. 1797.
ca. 1797. Medium: plain weave cotton
Technique:printed by engraved plate. Gift of Cora Ginsburg. 1994-80-6-a/c.
